http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/descript.@value: IRRIG is an Irrigation Ontology for experimentation in TSCF, Irstea Clermont-Fd.

http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/title.@value: Irrigation ontology for experimentation in TSCF

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: The inference result that determine the crop growth state at a specific time.
The act that a sensor carries out an crop growth observation.

Situation that a crop growth property has qualitative data that distinguish with other situations. This is a definitive class including the following states: init, v2, v7, v7d25, r1, r1d15, r5, r5hg45.
The inference result that determine the crop water need state at a specific time.
Situation that a crop water need property has qualitative data that distinguish with other situations. This is a definitive class including the following states: init, no, yes, wait.
Property dedicated to the growth of plants.
Property dedicated to the intensity of rainfall.
The act that an actuator carries out an irrigation action.
Property dedicated to the moisture in the soil.
Situation that a rain intensity level has qualitative data that distinguish with other situation. This is a definitive class including the following states: init, light, moderate, heavy.
Limits to define a rain intensity state and distinguish this state to other states.
The inference result that determine the rain intensity state at a specific time.
The act that a sensor carries out an rain quantity observation.
The act that a sensor carries out a total rain quantity per day observation.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#lab.@value: Rain Total Quantity Per Day Observation

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: Limits to define a root zone moisture level state and distinguish this state to other states.
The inference result that determine the rootzone moisture level state at a specific time.

Situation that a root zone moisture level has qualitative data that distinguish with other situation. This is a definitive class including the following states: init, saturated, very high, high, average, low, very low, dry.
The act that a sensor carries out an root zone moisture per day observation.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#lab.@value: Root zone moisture per day observation

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: The act that a sensor carries out an average moisture per day observation at 30 cmp depth soil.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#lab.@value: Soil 30cm Depth Average Moisture Per Day Observation

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: The act that a sensor carries out a moisture observation at 30 cm depth soil.
The act that a sensor carries out an average moisture per day observation at 60 cmp depth soil.

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#lab.@value: Soil 60cm Depth Average Moisture Per Day Observation

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: The act that a sensor carries out a moisture observation at 60 cm depth soil.
Property dedicated to the stress of plants.
A sensor that measures the rain fall.
A sensor that measures the soil moisture.
A sensor that measure weather conditions.
An actuator that open the water valve.
A relationship identifying the manufacturer of an entity (e.g., device)
A relationship identifying the model of an entity (e.g., device)
A relationship providing the name of an entity (e.g., device)
